children.subject: This is because you are currently an undeclared student, and have not yet officially declared the CS major.  When you declare, we create an entry in our internal database and this links to the faculty advising system.
I received an error while trying to register for a session. I am told that I am not authorized to use the application due to not having a student record in the local database. What should I do?
Tele-Bears appointments have not been released to students yet.  Appointments will likely be released in the next week; we're just being pre-emptive.

Oh Great!  They weren't released on Friday, and this was the last time I checked.  I still don't have access in Bearfacts so I imagine Cal Central is the first place they're uploaded; I imagine Bearfacts will have them later today or early tomorrow then.
Should I have a telebears appointment date? (I don't.)
When you say another faculty advisor, do you mean a new faculty member in addition to the current faculty? We generally have new faculty each term.

Sorry, I phrased the wording really badly. I meant will we have the chance to change our faculty advisor next semester?

But on that note, do the same faculty advisors stay each time? Or will some drop out/more added in?

Thanks for clarifying.  For LSCS, you are able to change your advisor every semester.  We don't "reserve" your prior advisor like the EECS system does.  That being said, it's true that faculty change every semester so there's a chance you would need to change anyway.  We are in discussions on having a system just as awesome as EECS' in the coming semesters, but will let you know when there's a timeline for that.
Will there be another faculty advisor choosing the next semester for Fall 2015 classes?
In his office, which is 377 Soda Hall.
Where should we meet Christopher if we signed up for a 15min timeslot with hunn.youcanbook.me?

history.content:
Greetings CS Majors,
 
Tele-Bears for Spring 2015 is here!
 
In order to obtain your adviser code to register for classes, you must attend a group advising session with an EECS faculty member.  Several group advising sessions will take place between OCTOBER 9 - OCTOBER 29. At the end of each session, a faculty or staff member will provide an advisor code for your Phase I registration appointment.
 
 
1. IF YOU INTEND TO GRADUATE in SPRING 2015 (next semester):
 
You do not need to attend a session, but you do need to schedule an appointment with me or Lily so that we can make sure that you're clear to graduate.  At the appointment, we will do a degree audit and then provide your advisor code. Book an appointment with me here; book an appointment with Lily here.  If one of us looks particularly busy then feel free to try the other.  This appointment usually does not take very long (15 minutes or less).
 
IMPORTANT: We will not have access to advisor codes until October 9th or shortly after, so please do not book an appointment before then. If you're graduating this semester (Fall 2014), and would like to make sure you're clear to graduate, please feel free to book an appointment as well.
 
2. IF YOU ARE A CONTINUING STUDENT:
 
Please use the link below to register for one of the faculty group advising sessions.  Sessions are filled on a first-come, first-served basis, so I highly recommend that you register immediately.  Because we are experiencing an unprecedented surge in majors, it is entirely possible that the sessions before your Phase I appointment will fill quickly; please act accordingly.  
 
IMPORTANT: If you do not register for a session in time for your Phase I appointment, then you will have to register after your Phase I begins. There are NO exceptions to this and we cannot provide an advisor code until after you have attended a session.  It pains me to see students miss their enrollment period and have to wait for a later session, so please be proactive.  

System idiosyncrasies: While we are working on a new, superior system, please keep in mind that this system is dated and has some issues.  PLEASE Write down/take a picture/print your session time and location because there is no way to check later (except to email me and this doesn't scale well).  Also, please register just once.  Sometimes students accidentally register for multiple slots which adversely affects your peers.  
 
Register for a session here, now!
 
OTHER COMMENTS (missing sessions, double majors, and triple majors):
 
If you miss or don't register for a session, and are unable to at a later time, you will definitely miss your initial Phase I window.  Make-up sessions will not begin until after ALL faculty advising sessions have concluded (no sooner than October 29 and possibly much later); please don't find yourself in this situation.  
Double majors will receive two digits of their advisor code from each of their two major departments.  To repeat, you'll receive half of your advisor code from us and the other half from your other major. Triple majors receive two digits from their first major and one digit from each of their other two majors. 
the very best to you all,
Christopher
